contents: The app has a lot of content, from meals to meditation to exercise. However, I would be very useful if the app and website worked. There are constant crashes stating, "My session has expired." Apparently, this has been an issue before. Usually it fixes itself within a short amount time, few minutes, but today has been different mirroring peoples' issues for the past few years.

I have a subscription, but as I navigate through the app I keep receiving a message saying my session has ended and I keep needing to log back in. I need to do this MULTIPLE times within a few minutes. It's making the app unusable. Extremely disappointed by this. Also, please add the ability to keep the timer going on workouts when I lock my phone. I'm not trying to keep my phone screen on for an entire 40 minute period.

The program and workouts are great. The main issue is that the app is borderline unusable. I have a Galaxy Ultra and it kicks me out to log in almost every time I select a workout. Some mornings I can't even use it all together (about half). Don't buy it until this is fixed. Customer service's response was "Use our free YouTube channel".

Doesn't work half the time. You can't open most of the workouts and it randomly signs me out when I try to access the app. Clearing cache and uninstalling it doesn't work. It sometimes takes days before it'll work again. I've emailed support numerous times and was told they are aware of the issue and a fix will be out eventually. What BS is that?! For the cost of this app, I should be able to expect that it works every time. Even when it does work, it's good but not great.

Could use some more personalized features. Would be nice if it had better descriptions available prior to the coached workouts. I'm traveling alot and my internet connections are "unreliable" so would be nice to stage/download workouts on my phone. They do seem to refine and update often. All in all, I've found it's generally been a great app for my needs.

Worked great for the first month. Now I can't even get into the app. When i log in I'm automatically logged right back out and it says Session timed out... so now I can't access any of my workout program or meal plan! I couldn't even get in to cancel my subscription if I wanted to! I need this problem fixed because I do enjoy the app a lot... when I can actually use it!

I liked the app for a long time, and the workouts are good and helping to reach my goals. However, currently, I'm experiencing an issue where it constantly logs me out and takes several attempts to work, if at all. I am hoping that the membership fee is prorated for this consistent timing out.

So sad to write this as the workouts are great but I've been unable to login for a week and a half on any platform. That's just not acceptable on a paid workout app. And it's not the first issue I've had. This isn't hard - it's not like medical records or encrypted chats or anything, it's literally a list of workouts, that's it. But it's been a significant interruption to my routine so sadly I'll be finding a new platform.

Rarely ever glitches and just great workouts. This app and the programs and meal planning are very well done. There hardly ever glitches or mistakes in the coached workouts and the team does a great job of providing helpful queues while allowing us to do our thing a sbest we can. I haven't tried to make a meal yet but with everything portioned out and all you have to do is cook it, I can't wait to try because the meals just look so good! They have vegan, vegetarian, gluten free options/solutions

I haven't been able to access my programs reliably for 2 weeks. I used to love using this app for workouts, but this frustration has made me reconsider renweing my subscription. They sent out an email announcing a new program 6 days ago, even while the app is unusable. Smooth.

The app is a complete joke but the workouts are great when you can get to them. My free trial was great, really happy with it. As soon as it wasn't free anymore the app doesn't work. It constantly asks me to sign in and I can't get to my coached workouts. 2nd day in a row. On the verge of canceling

This app is completely worth it! What really sets this apart for me is the mixture of workout, nutrition, and mental health. The meals are easy and delicious, even my teenager will eat them. The workouts are just right, with a lot of options. I love all of the educational information that is shared. The meditation, breathing exercises, and calming sleep sounds really help me to focus on de-stressing my life. The planner makes it really simple to follow.

The app is awesome, The workout options are awesome, The food is awesome, everything is awesome..... Except one thing. You cannot use this app without an internet connection. I spent more than $100 in internet fees trying to get it to work on a cruise ship. Likewise, while working in an area with bad internet; I wasn't able to use it while traveling for work.

It's been pretty good so far! The app runs smoothly and there are a lot of different workouts to choose from. The recipe selection is awesome as well! My only constructive criticism would be with the workouts themselves, sometimes the trainer who is supposed to be doing to beginner version gets caught up in the work out and does the advanced. It makes it hard to follow if you need a lower level without having to back out of the workout and find the beginner level example. It's great though!!!

It's good. Gets the job done. Wish there were more focused workouts. Like just arms, legs, core...most are all body. Is definitely a more individual style. Less interaction. And they video in segments that they mix and match, so you'll repeat segments in different workouts. The voice over can be a little weird sometimes. For the most part, I like it. I get a good sweat it. It's cheap, the music works for me and settings are beautiful. I do wish there was a way to track the workouts you do.

Pros: The workouts are great and the recipes seem good. Cons: uses all your data. Everything on the app requires you to be online at all times and you can't download anything even the shopping list. The workouts are one long video so if you accidentally touch the screen while working out you lose your place and have to manually find your place every time. Screen has to be open for the videos to play. This app was not worth the price.

I downloaded Centr because of the free trial offered during COVID-19, and ended up paying the annual subscription after the trial. I enjoy the app because it does a majority of the thinking for you, and I've seen quality results. There is a variety of nutrition options and workout styles. Most meals are very quick to make, and I've been able to complete all of all workouts I've tried under an hour (in a gym and at home). The interface is very user-friendly as well. 10/10, I recommend.

I signed up for the year package. So far I think the app design is beautiful, love the recipes and most of the workouts! But it is incredibly irritating that so many of the workouts are duplicates of each other (or very very similar within each of the trainers). I would prefer to have fewer different workout to choose from than having to look through 100 workouts to find one that is unique from the others. Could also use some work with the filtering system and be able to sort by workout time.

Initially I really loved this app, however the longer I use it the more I've realize how repetitive everything is. I've done 2 of the 6 week challenges now and its just the same few workouts over and over. Even the commentary is repeated over and over. Don't even get me started on how horrible the music is. I really appreciate the live workouts they are not so monotonous.

When I first began using this app I was a little discouraged. Most of the exercises were hard for me even at the beginner level. But when the Unleashed program came out, I was able to do the low impact options, and now I'm becoming stronger. I don't feel discouraged anymore and I'm utilizing the features of this membership even more. The trainers keep you focused and moving forward.

Excellent app! Easy to navigate, especially through workouts and meals. The shopping list function rocks! I love that you are able to adjust the meals for the amount of servings and the shopping list automatically adjusts the amount of ingredients needed. The meditations put my 11 year old to sleep. And for the boy parents out there you know that isn't easy! This is everything I have been looking for💖

Workouts are great. Food is also good-- always going to be one or two recipes you don't like, but over all most are really tasty! The Facebook group is a great community. Informative, encouraging and the people are funny as hell too 😂 Not a fan of the meditations for the most part as I prefer more reflective and body oriented than the visual guided style. They do have a mix of both, but so far no way for you to swap them out if you prefer one over the other. Overall great app!

A couple things I would change is 1. The ability to exclude equipment-based workouts for those who don't have the equipment or a gym to go to, and 2. Being able to make a meal plan that focuses on a few ingredients, rather than many. I can't afford to go and buy a massive variety (especially at the price of this app), and going through to handpick your meals kind of defeats the purpose of paying for at least that portion of the app. Great app for those with the money and time.

This app has changed my life!!! I've always been skeptical of any type of online/app style workouts but Chris & his trainers have put together a fantastic platform for anyone who wants to try it out (no matter what level you're starting at!). I absolutely love the added touch of meals & snacks. Eating healthy has always been my hardest struggle with getting in shape. Not because I don't like healthy food, but because my options to cook at home always seemed so limited. Centr is the best program!

Tried the free trial and was absolutely blown away and had to get the year subscription! A fantastic change of pace to my fitness regimen and a welcome switch up for my home programming. I love that it requires almost no equipment and still kicks your ass. The food choices are great, too. While I haven't done every single meal it's loaded, I have really enjoyed the choices I have done and love the fact that it creates a shopping list for you. Grade A+++

Don't bother with the reviews saying it's all about the $. I cancelled minutes before the week trial was up (based on the time stamp) and wasn't charged. Gave it some thought and signed up. The workouts are very well structured, I would only suggest that they add a alternative to every exercise. They have it for some but not all. The recipes alone have been worth the $. VERY easy recipes to make a lot of healthy food. I cook 95% of my meals, and these are some of the easiest recipes ever.

Great app with room for improvement. The workouts are well structured and accessable but challenging. Love the variety of programs. The variety and quality of the meals and snacks are fantastic. At $10/month it's worth it for me. Some small annoyances: - There's no intro on how to use the app. You have to dig. - Self-guided workouts can't be cast to TV - No instruction (on form, etc) with the self-guided weightlifting. - Only syncs w Google Fit if you use mobile app, not website. Overall great!

A great app if you like working out at home. Different styles of work outs, different types of coaches. Has something for everyone, whether you're a beginner or more advance; it has meal planning, meditation. The only thing that prevented me from rating it 5 🌟 is some workouts can get repetitive and I would like if it can be a little more interactive .

Best investment, in my opinion. I'm self motivated and sometimes require a little direction, variety, and on occasion, a push. This app makes everything easy. The robustness of the workout variety is perfect for those days where I need something different. Because you know, it's opposite day. The meals are wonderful and the tracking is on point. Thanks Centr team!!!

I was skeptical at first, but the wealth of knowledge shared by these pros alone is worth it. Being able to swipe individual sets, jump into an all-new workout when you're not feeling it, and the nutritional tips are all fantastic. I do wish there was a log that would record all your completed workouts/meditations on one page, but maybe they'll update to include in the future ;)

update: so I signed up and tried the app, but just couldn't get into the workouts. enjoyed the meditation though. so I cancelled, but I still see I've been billed for three one year! 🙁 -‐------------------- Cant use free 7 day trail without signing up for a 1, 3, or 12 month subscription! I download with the intent to try it for 7 days to see if I liked it, but I don't like that it forces you into a subscription before you get to try it!

Overall pretty great app and program. A few shortcomings: meal plans are unrealistic unless you have a lot more time and money than the average person. Need a way to star/favorite certain workouts, curate our own plans. And definitely need a Roku app. But there's still a lot to like here, sticking with it for now.

Have been using the app for 8 months now. Did the 1 year subscription. At first it had bugs but they worked them out. Easy to use and they keep making it better. They add new workouts and recipes to keep it fun. I took a few workout breaks as life got busy but could not give up the food. Doesn't feel like a diet. I just know how to cook now... If you stick to it getting into shape is inevitable. Highly recommend!

Fantastic app!!! Love the recipes, the workouts, and the meditation exercises! However this app is ungodly expensive, and I'm not talking about the subscription (which is also expensive) but the amount of groceries you need to buy, and time to make everything! Plus it often includes at least one ingredient I've never heard of and have to play detective to find. This app is a full time job! 100% recommend if you have free time and a good amount of disposable income. However this app is great!!

This app has everything you need and then some! I am never disappointed with a workout I conquer or a meal I choose to make! It has a variety of options at a variety of fitness levels. The meal planner has amazing options, things I would never thought I could eat while trying to get fit! It even has content that helps with mindset and mental health! The app is easy to use and functional, and gets better with every update!

I've been using the Centr site since the beginning, which had done pretty well on my Android phone. The workouts themselves are better for those looking to improve flexibility, the muscle building options are just "ok." This app was worth the wait! Buttery smooth interface, the workout checks off as complete when I'm done (the web version did not), and I can play my music while the video plays and still hear the trainer. Well done! 👏

Lots of potential, good so far! Workouts are good, but not a whole of options or flexibility just yet on programs or customizations. Nutrition menu looks good, but the variety every week makes it seem like the menu is meant for people with a lot of discretionary funds, especially when trying to cook for just one person. With COVID, a lot of my workouts were limited in equipment. I was saddened to see that Centr didn't allow for pausing of subscriptions or extending subscriptions though

I tried the first day for workouts and tried the meals and it is good. I like the wide variety of options that Centr offers. But, my one annoyance is that if my phone rotates or I change screen, the fitness app loses my progress through a workout. I have to scroll back down to where I was, which can be frustrating. I would of sent a note in the app with this suggestion but there isn't a section for that.

Work outs are good. I am at advance level. My reason for the one star is that the app doesn't work very well on Mac laptops, iPad, or Android phones. Yes I tried trouble shooting. There isn't much description of the movements either. No constant coaching just doing. And sometimes the videos keep going and going until you make it change next.

Not a terrible app, but has its flaws. A lot if videos on the app don't load fast enough to really keep watching one after one and it sucks to work out and have to wait for the video to load. Has good recipes and good workouts, including modifications for if you don't have all the equipment. Wish the workouts had some more variety though. Aside from those issues its $40 for a month! Which i only got because I had accidentally forgot to cancel my free trial.

Potential, but the app is too busy. There is a lot of content in this app, but unfortunately that strength is also a weakness. It's pretty hard to navigate around and find plans and programs that are right for you. Most modern fitness apps using AI and machine learning to tailor specific workouts to you based on goals, body weight, fitness experience, etc. This one makes you wade through a sea of opens and plans that quickly become overwhelming. More surveys with custom recommendations plz

I have enjoyed the app so far. It is easy to use and understand. The built in shopping list is arranged well, but could be improved to group things where you'd get them in the store, versus pantry item etc... The workouts and amazing and worth the subscription. If your in shape or want to get in shape/back into shape I highly recommend it. Give it a shot, what can it hurt aside from muscle soreness.

This app is by far the best exercise app I've ever personally used or heard of. I think most of what makes it so great is the planner which automatically plans your meals and gives you your workouts. There are small places where improvements could be made - I'd like to be able to add a program directly to my planner, and it would also be nice if there was a list of things that I should keep stocked in my kitchen for the meals, but those don't detract much from the perfect experience I've had.

Love it! I love that this app plans all your meals, including delicious snacks, workouts and meditation and sleep visualizations all in one. The meals are delicious and pretty easy to make with a delicious variety of snacks that are both savory and sweet. The workouts are challenging and you can adjust based on your level of experience.

The program is overall good, however, I'm giving 2 🌟 because the app crashes a lot. Sometimes it skip the rest, freezes and also it doesn't allow me to open it with my VPN. In addition, it looks like the body muscle program is made for men. Women have different body behavior and the program doesn't look to take it into account. I would like to see and improvement on it.

As someone who has done a few workout programs I would say this is my favorite so far. The meals they have aren't always easy to get ingredients for, but if you can make them they are tasty. You can swap meals, or can figure out your own diet plan. Being able to change the difficulty is great. The fact that you can swap a workout if you don't have the equipment or because you're feeling something else is an awesome benefit of this app. This is an awesome program. Thanks Chris and team!

They've built the workouts with alternative exercises for those who don't have fancy workout equipment at home. They include meditation guides and healthy recipes. I don't bother with them myself, but I appreciate the option. Personally, I prefer going to a gym with a coach who can guide me right then and there, but this was nice to have with covid shutting everything down.

Best whole person wellness app I've used!! As a wellness professional I looked for something to recommend to my clients that they will stick to. This has everything in one place (Workouts, Guidance, Meal planning/education, meditations) and they plan it out for you according to your preferences. You can swap out things that aren't what you want for that day easily. Love it🤩🤩🤩💯

Really not worth it as someone with an appreciable fitness background. Functional training workouts are good, but Torre workouts are repetitive and stale, focus too much on legs and overall the program is cookie-cutter, not very adaptive. I actually lost strength and some size in my three months on the program (used it through browser because the app wasn't out). It is a good for weight loss, toning up (maybe) or just starting, but not built for gaining muscle. Food is expensive.

This app had really kick-started my fitness journey. I've been struggling for a while with eating and exercising. I started this during a free trial and liked enough that I opted to keep the subscription. They have guided and self-guided workouts with everything from no equipment to heavy equipment. They have some great recipes to enjoy. I've only been using the app for a few weeks but am already seeing and feeling results. I'm starting to look forward to exercising in the morning with this app.

The app is amazing! It's very convenient, exercises are shown with varying difficulties for beginners, intermediate and advance users. Alternative workouts also shown, excellent recipes that cater to vegans,vegiterians and everybody else with adjustable serving size. Please add option to save favourite recipes for easy access or add like/dislike option on recipes so that they can be repeated or replaced in the future.

Love that the app guides you on how to use it. Can be a little confusing at first. The couches guide you through the workouts before you actually start and you can pick whatever level of fitness to accommodate you. The positive podcast, health articles & sleep meditations are great. The meals are amazing and you save a grocery list on the app so you dont forget. Would recommend to anyone no make what level of fitness you're at.

You don't have to be Hemsworth for these exercises. They vary from absolute beginner to will hurt you with or without weights. Huge variety of exercises and recipes. They'll choose your foods for you and give you a shopping list if you want. The price is steep monthly buy quickly gets cheaper with a longer subscription. I've tried other apps but this one is the best, hands down.

Now with Chromecast support... Mostly First things first: the program works for me. Keeps me engaged, coming back, and it's constantly adding content. The app is now finally better than the mobile site. Quicker to start, search, no signing out after every session, etc. Now for the "bad": Chromecast is only available for coached workouts and programs, not self-guided. New releases aren't properly announced. I found out about centr6 through a third party news article weeks after release.

Great workouts! They are easy to follow, no matter you level. The app shows you how to do each workout as you are working the plan, instead of having to remember how to do the exercise... Which could lead to you doing it with or with bad form and hurting yourself! I'm glad I started using the app. My focus was one the weighted workouts, but the recipes and other exercises is a great addition to what I was looking for.

Superb, less of an app and more of a way of life. What I love is both the variety of extremely great exercises that includes everything from straight up weights to yoga and Pilates to some new styles of functional training and boxing, but also a huge selection of food and snack options, meditation and wellness advice. You can easily search and find what you want, or just let the system guide you based on your preferences. Can't recommend enough!

Great workouts with variety so far. Love the daily checklist of things to do with exercise, articles and meditation all in one place. Meditation and mindfulness is something I need more of and I appreciate the daily programming. Tried some meals but found them a bit bland so paused for a bit. May try later again. Overall even without using the meals worth the price IMO.

I was using the website for almost a year when the Android app finally released. Centr is reasonably priced, has great variety of workout types with enough routine built in to stick with it, and solid recipes with a meal plan schedule (this is harder to stick with for me since I get bored of meals quickly). The app is simple and works well. I do wish there were more features (some sort of stat log, sync to fitness tracker, etc), but I love the program.

I like this app. The recipes are surprisingly good. They use whole foods and consider texture, which is so important and often missed. I've also learned some important lessens about how to stay full during the day. I do wish the recipes were released more often, which may be asking too much. There is a big selection of exercise options. I need low to no impact and still found enough options to stay busy.

I know they are just getting started and I already love it, I know as they add more programs it will be even better, I love the modifications they offer also. Great app, great price. I have to agree with another reviewer about the warm up and cool down, a little variation would go a long way! It does get old to do the same (especially warm up) every day for weeks. Definitely not a deal breaker for me though :-)

Awesome all in one (meal, workout, meditation & sleep visualization) program. I've been using the app & program for almost 5 months now and love it. Having my workouts & meals in one app is a huge time saver for me personally. I have found the majority of the meals available to be very good and there is enough variety to where I have not had to make things over and over again. On a pure app basis the only issue I've had is meals not clearing when I hit done so I have to do this a couple times.

Great content and easy to navigate. I like that I can hit complete on a workout to track my progress in the Program, butit would be nice to filter which workouts I've completed in the other workouts. The big issue I have is with the meditation player. I'll hit play, exit the page and browse while it is still playing, return to same page but the player is reset while the same meditation is still running, which means I can't stop it. Playing a new one doesn't cancel the old, they just overlap.

Positive encouraging, non aggressive, while still pushing for more. Solid workouts that will give you what you put into them. Recommend seeing a personal trainer for a while to get your forms down and to modify exercises based on your body mechanics/restrictions. Still they have a good breakdown of forms at all levels so if you spend the time with them you will be able to do them properly. I originally signed up for 3 months, took a break, but am now on for a year. Solid app. Thank you.

Very polished and a well designed app. Love the cards based design and of course all of the info. Was training via the site option so having an app is incredible and convenient. One feature request is to have offline access similar to Netflix for example, at least limited for a few days when you travel and want to exercise but have no connection to wifi or network. A few other things are missing here and there, but otherwise love the program and the app. Cheers!

I LOVE this app! I never have to miss a workout when I'm out of town, and I always have the shopping list I need to make the meals for the week. I am thankful for the variety of workouts, the amazing and talented coaches, the helpful articles, and the great tasting meals my whole family enjoys! The layout is super easy to follow.. workout, meals and meditations all in one place. Couldn't be happier!!! Thank you, Centr!!!

Brutal, but in a good way! The app runs well and is trimmed down of features on others that I would never use. Casting to my TV makes workouts easy to do throughout my house and convenient when travelling. The team seems to really know their stuff and sort through the technical aspects to being you the most user friendly and seemless experience. Also having workouts based around bodyweight or minimal equipment is perfect for quarantine and beyond. Here's to many days of sweat, pain, and gains.

Great daily workout plan. I am not able to use the diet plan as much as I would like, but when I have the food has been fantastic. It's great being able to just often the app and follow the routines it has. Love everything from the weights to the yoga. The only downside is not being able to save workouts in the event you don't have service (which I do with work frequently). Highly recommend this app!

Beautiful but only for the entirely able-bodied. The aesthetics are great and the coaches lovely, but there's no option to avoid high intensity exercises in the daily schedule. For someone like me with a back issue, I can't just go with the recommended lessons but have to go find the Pilates or yoga exercises they have for myself. It's a shame, as I had already purchased a three month subscription but can't use it as much as I'd like.

I'm very optimistic from what I've seen so far. I love that meditation is part of the regimen. There are a few features, however, that I've found to be very helpful but I've not found them in a single app. Please consider: 1. Integration with Google Fit/other fitness trackers. 2. Weight training trackers/log (what exercises, how much weight, how many reps etc) 3. Ability to sort/edit meals that include certain foods (eg diabetic menu, allergies, or just plain don't like certain ingredients?)

Good exercises and workout plans. Terrible customization and interface. Would be 5 if we could pick our own program, filter/exclude certain exercises, better logging and graphs to track progress. Overall it's a pretty app with good content, but that content is too hard to use outside of the force-fed 'program'

I have been using this for a month now, and it is good so far. I need to expand my weights at home tho as I progress through because from what I gather, the exercises only vary slightly as you go from begginer to intermediate, and up. The only disappointing aspect of the mobile app (I don't know if this holds true for tablets) is when I'm using the coached/guided workouts when my phone flips betwe portrait and landscape it starts the video from the beginning... Annoying when in the middle of it.

For the first time ever I remembered to cancel a subscription before the trial period ended, but imagine my surprise when I was charged the full amount just 2 days later. I assume there must be a mistake, and log online to find that I still have an account somehow. I cancel again, and contact customer service to sort this out. Only to be told that I never canceled and will not be receiving a refund. Even though I've canceled TWICE and contacted CENTR within 24 hours of the charge. Terrible.

Program is good, but app needs refining. Suggestions: easier way to cast (i.e. from video, not desktop or through screen mirror) - MUST.  Save shopping lists or meal plans. Create & save user defined workouts from the self guided workout clips (mix and match!). Favorite meal & workout function to make it easier to repeat liked, disliked, ambivalent. At the top of the shopping list, the app lists all recipes. This should be clickable and single recipes easily removed not just a clear all.

I love this app. It's what I have been looking for. The ability to like or heart your favorite workouts or meals would be awesome. 10/12/20- update: This continues to be a decent app, if I could change 1 thing, it would be the menu. It is nowhere near realistic for people who work. Designer meals arent practical.11/15/20- I know I can switch my meals, problem is that they are unrealistic. I can guarantee the maybe 2% of people actually make these meals.

I was very hesitant to try this app when my fiancee found it a few months ago. I've been working out and playing sports competitively my whole life but had taken the last year off of fitness due to a promotion at work that increased stress and hours tremendously. I just finished week 4 of the Centr 6 program and WOW! I see a massive change in my energy levels, overall health and mood and yes..I can finally see my abs again! (Mostly). I would recommend this app to everyone at all levels!!

Love it. Centr Unleashed!!! Getting me though it. Suggestion, for the couched workouts and the program workouts. Sometimes movement variations are given halfway through the set or in the second round. Would be more effective for the a beginner to these movements to have all the information before attempting something they cannot really do and potentially hurt themselves only to later find out there is something more manageable until they can safely to the other stuff.

Such an amazing work out app! I use it everyday and it is WELL worth the money! It's super functional and easy to use. It's great for all different types of people whether you're a beginner or more advanced, you WILL find a challenge with this app!! They also have different payment plans and options if you aren't interested in having the app for a 12 month period.

I'm really disappointed with this. It's cheaply done. The routines on the 6 are good, but unless you're an expert, you'll find even the easy stuff difficult 1) there's no 10 sec back button. If u pause your body, it's tough to catch up. 2) there are no play by play instructions. You need to watch them at all times, which makes focusing on what you're doing yourself very, very difficult. 3) they don't show you how to perform a move, they expect you to know everything before you work out.

The app itself is worth the money. When my trial ended however... it billed me for the full year (102$) which was unexpected. It was not clear how the billing would be handled i was under the impression it would be 8$ a month. Aside from that, there is a ton of good info on the app so- definitely worth it.

Your shopping list is lacking, particularly around the understanding that people have other things besides your recipes that they might want on the list. These things easy get unintentionally wiped when starting lists or removing recipes. Also, meditation is so much more than a new-agey stress ball. Your content in that area disappointing. Great workouts and recipes!

Pretty good programming for almost everyone. I would like to see a body part exclusion from a workout. Some of either get injured or have lifelong issues. To be able to stick with a workout plan, but have other exercises recommended for our exclusions would be perfect. Outside of that I'm having a lot of fun. P.s. $30/month I feel like Thor should be in the list of coaches I can choose to pull a workout from.

App and general experience are worth the money, compared to competing alternatives. But, there's no native ability to cast the apps videos to, for instance, a Google Chrome Cast. A workaround for this "in home" is to use the Web App and cast the whole desktop of your computer. But latency issues not related to the app persist with that method specifically when streaming video, which is the whole point of this. Would love to see casting ability worked in to the app in the future!

Great App! The workouts are phenomenal and give you the variety that you need. I've been doing the muscle build and have been able to modify to fit my sever back issue. The daily meditation is clutch though.. I started doing it before we were all dealing with the pandemic, so it was already in my routine and has helped me immensely with my sleep. Highly recommend!

The app and the content itself are great BUT there's no offline playback function. You can't download a workout, not even temporarily, and the only solution given for this is to use their workout image option in the self guided workouts. So old fashioned!! With a 25min vid chewing up >1GB you'd better be somewhere that has wifi or upgrade your data plan! Definitely need a fix for this.

Love the app, it helps me get high intensity work outs in without having to shell out for too much equipment. I wish there was an off line mode though, would make it easier to do work outs outside. My only concern is that there is not an easy way to change my subscription plan. I started with only 3 months because I wasn't sure how I would like it (I love it). But now I want to change to the yearly plan and I'm not able to do that from the app.

I LOOOOOOOVVVVEEEEE this app. The variety of workouts and meals (and I'm vegan) makes it so easy to stick to. There are only a couple things that would personally make this better. 1. For the shopping list to group items together better. 2. I would love to be able to add programs I'm doing to my planner. I love seeing my day all laid out. And just wink wink Centr, an app on smart TVs would take this over the top!

These are good workouts, & the app is pretty easy to navigate with planner, workouts (saved/active), meal planning/shopping list. Workout wise, if ur the type of person that pushes hard when an instructor suffers along & completes workouts, I'd rate a few, like Centr Unleashed 1* star. They record 1 set & repeat 3 times, so they don't really do the work with u all the way through. Even warm up & cool downs r copied & pasted in every track. Voice overs r weak & demotivating. Better muted.

Centr is solid overall and my go-to workout app recommendation for friends. So far, over the past year, I've only had 1 login issue, which was solved after a day or so, and a few errors with pulling up the daily workout (which resolved after a force close / restart of the app). There's something for every workout goal/style and the meal planner is hugely helpful with scaling around your fitness goals.

Outstanding. The program has lots of variety and some of the best pandemic-isolation-friendly body weight and minimal equipment workouts I've seen. It's also great to have meal planning options built right in, which you can use as much or as little as you want. The app works very reliably and supports Chromecast!

This is probably my least favorite workout app I've tried so far. The workout videos are really sub par. The instructions for exercises feel rushed and the trainers are just not that engaging. They feel really disconnected from their product, almost like they had to do it quickly to just get it over with. The exercise pool is also incredibly limited and focus heavily on equipment so if you're like me and only have dumbells, you'll quickly run out of routines.

This app lacks customization in regard to the program you are put into. Very little questions are asked about health and fitness levels. There are no real goals or encouragements. This is a no frills fitness/diet app. No step or calorie counter, but they do provide a really good daily menu. We are a vegan home. The recipes provided were nice and filling. You can adjust servings and are.provided a grocery list. I just don't feel this app is worth the money right now. It's too simplistic for me.

I've really liked the so far. Workouts are great. Food is great (but tough to keep up with at times with kids). My only complaint is that there isn't a built in reminder system to help plan the day in regards to workouts, meditations, etc. I sit at my desk all day, so at times I forget to get up and move. Having a helpful reminder in-app that would get me up to walk and read an article or maybe do a meditation would make this the ultimate app in my opinion.

Fantastic exercises and trainers. I like that they don't just spend an hour yelling at you, but instead assist with form/ real talk. It provides recipes that are more enjoyable and "normal." Only one problem, the unlimited advanced week 3 day 2 is not checking off after completing it. Haven't had this issue before now.

Variated workouts, meal plans and meditations. This app has a lot for everyone. I only wish the planner was updated more often, (I feel I'm repeating the same workouts now that I'm almost 4 months into it, I do 2 or 3 every day) and the ingredients for meals more accessible. The programs are great, challenging and fun. I'm enjoying it a lot. If you have a few dumbbells or kettlebells at home it's like going to a class at the gym. The facebook community is amazing.

I can't find how to favorite things yet if that's an option. If Icould find that, this would be a 5 star. The workouts are great and you can really get something that fits to your needs. Like a week after starting, I injured my knee and had to back off to the more gentle workouts but I'm slowly getting back into it now that I'm healing nicely. The recipes are also amazing. I would definitely try a lot of these and have already started going through them. I love the espresso soothe. Get this app

They thought of everything for this app. I applaud the makers. I think the Centr app should be a case study for great UI and UX design. It has a shopping list for all the recipes that let's you cross off what you have and even categorizes them by grocery aisle sections. The workouts are great and meditations are so helpful. This app has helped me maintain a healthy lifestyle to be a better version of myself. 10/5 stars.

Pros: -combining nutrition planning and excercise classes is really helpful if you don't want to spend lots of time thinking about and planning those things-the programs are excellent, most of them are 4-6 weeks and give you a sense of real improvement and progress-i love tahl's dynamic yoga, she really makes you work. Cons-the recipes are not great, i often use them as a jumping off point and alter the spices and cooking methods. Many of the vegetarian options are unforgivably bland.

There support team is really awesome. When I first downloaded the app, connection to Google Fit worked, then about a month later it failed due to a security update. I contacted their team, and they had it fixed within the week. The workouts are fantastic, easy layout, and now a watch app too! Really enjoy it.

Just like having a personal trainer, at a fraction of the cost. I've been trying to eat healthier and go to the gym for the better part of a year. It's so hard to meal plan and hit all the macros. This plans out your entire week and gives you a shopping list depending on if you're try to loose, maintain, or gain. Plus also gives you corresponding workouts depending on the intensity and goals that you choose. For me, the app has worked well and any changes are reflected on my desktop PC.

I love this app! This is the first time I've used a 6 week fitness program from an app and really felt like it was working. The trainers are great at explaining the different movements and showing variations for low impact. They also do a great job at keeping me motivated for the whole workout! Instead of counting the minutes I have left, I'm always surprised at how quickly I'm done. I highly recommend this app for anyone that wants to get a great workout at home!

Great app so far! It makes health 10x easier by simply giving workouts and meals. Haven't had the app long and the only reason it isn't a 5 star for me is because I have yet to see change, but I have a feeling I will. A feature that would be amazing is something to help with a sleep schedule and something to keep you motivated.

The thing that's always kept me from going to the gym has been not knowing the proper form and workouts to do together to target the right muscles. The guided workouts have been great for this beginner! The only thing I wish they had incorporated in the workouts are cooldown stretches. (again, I don't know what to do to cooldown the muscles I just worked out 🤣)

Overall pretty good. I consistently get good workouts from the trainers. I really like the suggested meals and have found several favorites. Gripe #1 is you cannot download the videos for later, for those of us on metered plans this adds about 15 dollars to my phone bill. Gripe #2 while you can log your weights it's very basic logging. I would really appreciate a notes box to go along with the weight. I can't remember after a week if a particular set was challenging or not.

Great coaching and workout variety. One thing I've always struggled with is meal planning, and this app had perfect solutions. The planner allows you to switch out recipes, and pick out what fits your needs (vegan and gluten-free options are within the menu), AND my family likes the recipes. My spouse is especially excited now that I'm doing meal planning, and the meal planner even creates my shopping list for the week! The beginner level workouts are great at pushing without breaking the spirit

This app has saved me!! I purchased the app after I wasn't able to continue my martial arts training because of economic reasons. They have any and every type of workout for all levels. The coaches are so professional and funny, it makes it so much fun to follow the workouts even if you feel you are dying. The diet plan is so convenient and not as difficult as it might seems at first. During this quarantine it has been a true blessing to have this as a tool to keep up with my goals.

I've tried a few different programs over the past year, but if there is one that I have found really has helped me get back into Ice Hockey and Rugby shape, Centr has been one. It has covered everything from workouts to food/diet to meditations to articles about better sleep, all without getting stale, a problem I found with other apps. The trainers in it keep the guided work not only fresh, but very positive and encourage, something other apps seem to lose after a few weeks.

Excellent, easy to follow coached workouts with options for all levels. I also like the meditations and relaxation with expert trainers. Haven't used the meal planner much, but the few recipes I have tried are simple to prepare and tasty. Overall very happy with this program. It has been a saving grace with gyms closed.

I love it so far. Workouts: I chose the advanced and the workouts are tough! Some moves are currently impossible, but there are modifications. My favorite thing about the app is the meal plan functionality. It expidites my nutrition so I don't have to waste time with what I should make. Meals are tasty and quick to throw together. I use the vegan meal plan and I love that it is almost all whole foods. I have been trying to lose weight for a long time and it is finally happening!

This is the best fitness app I've ever used. It's balanced, joyful, funny, delicious, and makes me feel like I'm working out with my cool weird friends. The difficult level is actually challenging enough for a gym rat like myself (a problem I've had with most other apps), but the easy level is easy enough for my mom, who has many physical difficulties. The layout is GORGEOUS. It's a beautiful app, and I've never had an issue.

Great total program for fitness. I love how intuitive the interface is and easy it is to work out at my own pace as I set up my home equipment. There is flexibility built in to swap out meals and workouts and articles that help me make the right decisions on what to swap when. Subscription is more affordable than some of the other premium workout apps that are $30 to $40 a month.

Great app for someone that's an introvert or isn't comfortable working out in public, it would be nice if there were more simple choices on the menu, I don't have access to a lot of specialty foods and also have a pretty simple palate. My kids love listening to Chris for meditation so I wish he had more. Overall though this has been a positive experience.

Decent app, holistic approach, but missing some important parts. Many nutrition-added fitness apps make the same mistake: no filter for allergies. The planner would be fantastic to use if I could eat half of the food on there without MAJOR replacements that completely change the recipe. I'd give it 5 stars for that feature.

My bf and I have been using the app for about a week now and here's my suggestions so far: 1. Have an option to bookmark workouts, add them to "favorites," or let users create lists. 2. The filter settings go a little wonky as you select multiple options. Even when you press" clear" to start over, the options don't reset. You have to exit the page and come back. 3. It'd be nice to filter workouts by time required 4. Customize weekly planner ("no equipment" or a certain trainer for the week)

This is the best work out app and nutrition plan I have used. I feel better, have more energy and look forward to doing my work out. I love that there are options for different levels of difficulty and nutrition programs to match your end goals. The best feature is the shopping list. Add what your want for your meal plan and it adds all the ingredients to the shopping list.

Love all the workouts! You can choose your level; beginner, intermediate, or advanced. This is great to help you keep progressing. I also love the food. I haven't had one recipe that I haven't like yet! Overall. Highly recommend for anyone that's wanting to do at home workouts with minimal equipment!

It's a great app that really helped me actually drop a few pounds in quarantine. My one critique is the inconsistency in the formatting of the training videos (and occasional lack of explanation on how to do a given exercise), but on the whole it's a great workout/general wellness app

Great app that has made to easier for me to workout and cook. Love the recipes and variety of meals and workout options. I really wish it could link to food tracking apps like MyfitnessPal or something, so recipes can be exported. I've gained a couple pounds while on the weight loss track but without the ability to actually track my macros and calories on the Centr app itself, it's hard to know what's going wrong, even though nutrition information is provided on each recipe.

This app has great workouts and I have found the coached workouts are easy to follow. The recipes are fairly easy to follow and its improved my breakfast game. The reason it doesn't get five stars is because it's really lacking in personalization. It doesn't help you tract your weight or personalize the meal plan to your height/weight/gender/activity level. As is, the meal plan portion of the app is highly lacking for what you pay for the app. I do really love the workouts though.

Great app so far. I love the planner and being able to customize it to my needs (like when I'm going out or having leftovers for a meal). It would be awesome if I could add my current program to the planner, instead of going into the programs tab at the bottom to access my workout.

I hadn't used my app over the summer (busy with kids) and got logged out. Can't find my pw anywhere so tried to reset and didn't receive any emails. Tried emailing support and kept getting back that they're "working on it". It's been a week now and I still haven't heard back. It's unlikely they're going to make up for the time wasted on this. I've never experienced such lack of urgency/competency for such a simple issue from any company/business large or small. I definitely will not be renewing.

This app is amazing it's a full package, amazing recipes workouts, meditations (including ones for kids which is awesome). It's the approach to fitness and workouts which makes it different fun and friendly workouts and eating well with delicious recipes. Honestly I think this should be put on prescription for people it's the best excercise tool I've used

Yes! Just stick with it a month and see if you like it. You gotta do it honestly. It works. Best workout app period! *Update: can not login to my account for 2 weeks. I am in week 17 of a 26 week program and I cannot access anything. Now I am not getting any response from customer svc... Update 2: issue resolved and received a free month.. they gave everyone workouts they could use after about 2-weeks of service interruption.. if this took 2-days i would give the 5th star back

Massive scam, avoid paying! Won't refund citing T&Cs, app won't open most of the time, when it does open you can't stay logged in long enough to do anything. If you pay for a service and you can't access the service, it is just theft. Look elsewhere.

App and programs are excellent. Customer support is the worst I've come across. Entire week without access, sent numerous emails no follow up or solution. In the end had to cancel my subscription and re join to get access.

I'm still on the trial period. The programs and exercises seem really good to get fit. I can't find though a way to use the app when I'm offline.This would be really helpful for me because due to work I spent many days way off internet (gsm-landline) coverage.

Amazing! Love the trainers and the workouts. Would love to see a few more programs focusing on weight loss and overall body strenght as well as pilates/yoga/stretching rather than muscle gain, (it feels like all the programs lately are focusing on muscle gain), but other than that it's great!

Edit: they resolved the authentication issues so I can use the app I paid for again. however, I don't have much trust in a company who laid off key staff keeping the app running, so I won't be renewing my subscription unless their is more transparency from the new leadership.

The planner is a great way to get started, when like me you have no idea what you're doing. I noticed results within the first couple of months, losing weight and getting more defined. Now using the programs, i find it challenging and I'm definitely getting more muscle definition. Only gripe is occasionally some of the meals are not that great. That said you can mark your favourites and then swap out any that don't look great. Overall very much worth the subscription.

Had originally given it 5*. It has great workouts and their method has yielded great results for me. But as so many have said, it's been 3 weeks since both app and website have started crashing and I see no response from developers. Sure they'll reply emails and complaints but it makes no difference if the issue isn't fixed. Specially since you're paying for it. Sadly disappointed.
There were a few technical issues recently, that although they took some time to get fixed, they eventually did. Aside from that love the app so much, 2 years of using it

EDIT: the newest update keeps signing me out every time I navigate between tabs (says my session expired). Impossible to use the app. I have re-installed, deleted, etc. PLEASE FIX!!!! **************** GREAT programs, great recipes, great videos! Only improvement would be the cool down vids in the ignite program. They seem a little generic and don't always 100% relate to the groups worked in the exercises.
I had so much confusion around building my workout and how to obtain my body goals. This app lays it all out for you with the ability to swap workouts that I'm not a fan of. Love this app.

Got an email saying redeem your credit, and all of a sudden I get a notification on a Saturday that a withdraw of 119 occured. Where's the credit? Where's the email stating y'all are charging? Haven't been able to get into the app and now this, on a Saturday evening?

This app has been my go to for over a year, but since my renewal came up, the app has been unusable. I keep being logged out and getting expired session error messages. Usually when you pay for a product or service, it's with the assumption you would receive access to said product or service. This feels like theft. I'm stranded without my meal planner, workout program and mediation library. What makes it worse is that there hasn't been much by way of communication from the Centr about a fix.

It's my second year using this app for working out. the programs are awesome, and the videos are easy to follow and convenient with many features for wellness. many of the workout movements in the programs are done even in gyms and best part is that it's not breaking the bank. with various levels from beginner, intermediate, and advanced, there's something for everyone. thank you for creating these functional, accessible and fun workouts that keep me healthy, especially with a busy life!

I was a complete novice at the types of intensive workout in this app but the clear supportive guidance has got me doing challenging dumbbell exercises in just a couple of weeks. There is an impressive array of options which gave me a sense of control and confidence, and although I haven't explored them as much yet, what looks to be a good range of supporting guidance on meditation and diet. Love it! It's a new part of my daily routine!

Fantastic guide towards functional fitness, athletic strength, mobility, and general health that immediately changed my day to day routine. Results you can see in the opening weeks. Top tier, healthy, protein-packed recipes for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks.

I did the week free trial and absolutely love everything the program has to offer and was excited to continue my program. My card was charged and I assumed all was fine but now the app won't work and I'm in a continuous loop of the 'we dropped a Dumbbell' error message. try access anything else and I have to re log in. And back to dropping Dumbbell error. Same issue when I go on my pc and internet page on phone. tried uninstall/reinstall app no fix. So I've paid 1 year membership and no access.

Been with the app about a year, and while I don't use the recipes, I love that if I'm not doing a program, I can just use whatever the planner has set for me for the day's workout. Great coaches, video production, and workouts.

Amazing app, when it is working. Currently I can't sign on at all. It's too bad, I had just started the power program and was looking forward to it. I workout for my physical and mental health and when I don't have it, it affects me greatly. I hate to do this as I am sure centr is working hard to fix the problem. Ultimately though this is an expensive app and this is the second time it has completely crashed on top of the lagging and freezing that has been happening. I may have to move on.

Loved the app at first and would have rated it 5 stars for the fantastic programs and experienced trainers!! Second month in and the app keeps crashing, feeling annoyed that I've paid for a subscription I can't use..I've tried uninstalling to no avail. I've emailed but no response. I love the workouts, especially the 28 days of core as I am seeing positive changes, but can no longer log in. After reading through the reviews it seems this is a common occurrence. Please fix the issue 🙏

Some promising features that end up being executed poorly. Workouts for a start don't ever really feel massively challenging or backed by current science on the best way to train, surprising when Simon hill (one of the chefs) is part of the app and is all about science and health/fitness. Other points. Works terribly with a smartwatch, meals are either too sweet or bland, can't edit logbook after exercise. Have to say meditations are often good. Disappointed by this app and won't be renewing.

This is a fantastic app, everything you need for fitness and health. So many options to choose from workouts, recipes, trainers, meditations, etc. Love it. I've subscribed for several years. Just the interface has gone a bit clunky with the recent update - the headings have gone really bold and squashed up (android).

Everything was perfect till this last update. Now it logs me out every time I try to start a program and it does it multiple times until I can finally get into one then at the end it'll log me out again before the program is done. I emailed support sent my issue I really hope they get it figured out cuz the app itself is awesome and I just want the bugs fixed.

Money grab. Was given a free subscription for a year, told them I didn't want it when it renewed (the same day) and they ignored me completely when I emailed them. I never used the app either, but am now stuck with a subscription I didn't want for another year. I'm not the only one this happened to, so be aware once you subscribe you will have a hard time unsubscribing. Would not recommend.

Enjoying the workouts. There are many targeted programs from which to choose. Watch out for Lexi's cooldowns, they are another workout. They have changed the app and it is not great at first use. No chance to provide feedback. Some workouts are a bit out of whack.

All of a sudden the app has started timing out after logging in. Says the session has expired. I use this app nearly every day and it's incredibly frustrating to have paid as much as this is a year and not be able to access it. The website had no way to contact support or raise a question to help. I can't believe the product team hasn't rolled back. the latest update. makes no sense
I like that I can get a solid workout in in my own home in a half hour. I wish there were more at home programs to follow and that the strength building program has more than one level.
I love this app. It has been the only thing that has kept me motivated to workout on a regular schedule. 6 weeks in I have rcvd so many compliments
This app is like having a personal trainer in your pocket! It's worth the yearly membership. It motivates me to hit the gym because it's fun and throws unexpected routines at me!
Great app with a variety of workouts, programs, recipes, meditation sessions and more! Love it!
Great workouts when your short on time. Planning features are organized and instructors motivating.

I've been on the app for 6 weeks, after a 2yr hiatus from working out, and its truly transformed me. Im working out daily for the first time ever, can't recommend it enough. 2 weeks ago the app went down, and it upset a lot of people who probably loved the app up until that point. Hence, there are a ton of 1 star reviews over the last few weeks. Look past them! It's a shame this happened because the app is incredible and deserves a better score. I'm here to say that it's 100% working.

It was a good app until the last update. Now it is broken, constantly forcing you to relogin with a session timeout error. Because of this, none of the content is actually available. I had a year subscription and the app was broken for the last 56 days of my membership. I requested a refund for the last 56 days. Instead, they gave me a 30 day (not 56) coupon for my next membership, which is worthless since the app is still broken.
Game changer. They have all workouts you need covered with and without equipment. Not to mention the other modalities and nutrition advice

The app hasn't been working for me for 3 days now, it keeps saying login expired and logs me out. Please fix this because I love this app! Absolutely love this app! Doing the programmes like centr6 really keep me motivated and keep me on track. The meals are delicious too in the vegan section with a good variety and the option to change a meal is good as I may not like the suggested meal on day so I swap it.

I activated the monthly subscription with 7 day free trial and the app won't allow me to log in. It keeps stating I have to link subscription and then my session expired once I try to link. I've tried rebooting reinstalling nothing is working. now I'm going to be charged the monthly fee on an app I can't even open. it won't allow me to cancel the subscription in my Google play because I need to go into the app that won't let me in!!!!!!

Best workouts I've ever had. I'm definitely happy with seeing real results. The coaches are all amazing! Very motivating and super easy to follow and use. I love the recipes and meditation. It's made a huge impact all the way around. Thanks to Chris Hemsworth and his entire team!! Get this app is worth every second.

I really enjoy this app. Being able to select what equipment I have and this filter out the workouts that use only my equipment is awesome! The workouts are great also, being able to select how long of a workout and what muscle groups to hit makes things easy and great. I don't use the recipes much but it is a really cool thing to have and it's convienient that the app will make you shopping lists. I got a year sub. free when I bought my cable machine and will be renewing my subscription.

This app is just okay. The Good: - Nice interface - Nice variety of workouts - Lots of info on diet The Bad: - WearOS app. New watch app but still cant log weight on it. It's hard to log sets and weights going back and forth to your phone. It would be better if logging and rest timer would be on your watch. - Doesn't sync workouts with Samsung Fitness - When browsing meals, if you go into a recipe and then back out, the list of meals starts from the beginning again. - iPad app is shrunk.

Veriaty is good. However, there are so many different workouts to choose from, I didn't know where to start. The app didn't really get me motivated, so I lost interest. I then forgot about the app, didn't receive any notification of the subscription renewal until the payment of £93 came out of my bank account, leaving me in my overdraft. Contacted customer service in a panic & got a standard 'not our problem' response. Would not rate this app or customer service received. Very disappointed.

I love this app. Following the meal plan they set up for me (part of the app features) has led to my clothes that used to fit well fitting loosely. I'm not sure if I've lost weight, but I have lost size. Just from eating better without the hassle of finding healthy recipes. Centr already did the work. Add to that the fact that there's exercise programs I can follow w/ a coach or solo and DELICIOUS homemade snack options, the $120 for a year membership has paid for itself in less than 6 months.

Changing my review as frustration mounts. The app now asks to log back in every few seconds or so... After multiple attempts and precious time wasted, it may or may not work. The wow factor of the app diminishes greatly when going through such a customer experience. I've been using Centr religiously for almost 2 years and showing it off to friends and family, but this needs to get fixed asap please.

Pros: great content and programs when working. Cons: poor tech support and poor corporate communication when not working. 5 months into a year subscription and overall has been a 4/5 experience. As it gets closer renewal I'll have to assess how the rest of the year subscription goes. Prior to the August 2023 3 week outage, this was a 5/5 experience.

I absolutely love this app. It gives me motivation, challenges me and I can record my progression which I love. Unfortunately, today, however, I can't gain access to the app and now feel like I've lost a limb, as I can't get into anything. I have a busy job (like most people who buy fitness apps, as they don't want to plan workouts every day!) And now I'm having to think of workouts to do 😑🙈 Please update the app and fix this issue team!

I signed up for the trial and didn't like the lack of flexibility of adjusting my days of training, duration or other parameters. So, I decided to cancel the subscription, and I was late by only few days to cancel. They wouldn't refund a year worth of subscription even though I only used it once or twice. The worst app and customer service ever. Don't use it, there are better alternatives out there. All those people that have reviewed it are being paid a commission to do that .

I absolutely love this app but have no idea what is currently happening. You login, it loads and then kicks you straight out. This app is 100% unusable and what makes it worse is I am paying for this. The response to this problem has been minimal, and it has been occurring for a long time. It may be, if bot fixed, what makes me move away from this app even though it is extremely useful.

Update: Ive used this app for almost 2 years and have loved it and had no problems with it. Until this week. It now wont open the programs and signs me out. Its unusable in its current state. Centr, please fix this!!! Centr has been a real tool for changing my body composition. It has been a perfect introduction into weight training from someone who had no experience. My body is leaner and stronger and I really appreciate all of the encouragement and guidance with training and food consumption.

The app is fine. BUT BE CAREFUL WHAT YOU PURCHASE AS THEY HAVE A SNEAKY STRICT REFUND POLICY! I was pumped on the app during the week trial so I decided to do the 1 year subscription. Then after 10 days I had a look through the rest of the courses and decided that actually the app doesn't quite fit with my long term goals. I asked to be downgraded to the monthly plan & only refunded the difference, which I don't think should be a hard ask. THEY REFUSED! Very disappointed in this company

The app was relatively good and I have subscribed for a year however, for some reason now there is a prompt saying " your session has expired. Login again to access your Centr account" and if I do, as soon as I login again the same prompt comes up. Tried restarting the phone, reinstalling the app, deleting data and cache, nothing worked.

The content is good, but it's got the most incompetent implementation of a workout log I've ever seen in a fitness app. You can only access the log for your exercise when you are actively in the exercise, making planning or preparation really annoying.

Have had this app for some time and absolutely love it but the last four plus days it has logged me out and cannot log back in, same problem as many it seems. I am halfway through a program, had a long weekend off and had planned to get at least another four workouts in as I had the time, but that plan has failed due to the app. Please fix. People plan their busy lives around these workouts and being down for four plus days is not acceptable.

I like the app, the workouts and meal planner are great, but I keep having issues logging in. I'm on the last day of my free trial, and I've either dropped a dumbbell or my session has expired, even on the website! Big shame, but I can't commit to a year if I'm unable to access the app / website whenever I need.

Had this app for a few years. Good until now. Constant log in errors saying session expired. Cleared cache, cleared data and reinstalled. Still can't get in but what do you know the automated annual payment works fine. Very disappointed centr has taken my money but not provided a working service.

This app is the ducks nuts, it's got it all! Food, workouts and meditations there's nothing on this app that I don't use. If you're looking to get into great shape, lose weight, eat better, broaden your workout routine or just be more mindful the tools are all here for you all you have to do is show up an use them

When it worked, it was 5 stars. but now it's been bonkers for the past week or so, kicking me out of the app anytime I try to access any content. seriously considering canceling subscription as it seems contacting support has not gotten any of us anywhere.

I used to love the app, but it is having too many issues recently. Every time I select programs or profile, it logs me out and forgets my workout history. As a paid customer, this is very frustrating. I hope you fix it soon.

The content is great and I applaud the creators of the content, one of the best fitness products on the market. My issue however is with the developers of the app who have taken months ,and still counting, to fix login issues. Essentially the app continues to kick you out and several outages have been reported. I have reported this to Centr on multiple occasions asking them for a root cause analysis and resolution and they are not able to provide an answer. Hire good developers please!

Very good experience, nice to have a bit of structure to my work outs and have somthing to follow. An improvement I would make: make the timer continue to count down when using other apps. Maybe in the notification bar at the top..

Doesn't work. App constantly logs me out. What's going on in the past couple weeks?? Edit: 08/28 - they gave everyone a free month. That's cool but a free month of a app that does not work is fairly useless. Still not fixed and seems to be even worse

******I am so disappointed the app is literally not useable right now and has been like this for days. It won't stay logged in no matter what. You HAVE to be logged in to do anything, so right now you can't use it all.******* I was loving this app it is a great introduction to fitness. I did 5 complete programs then I started to do the daily workouts about a month ago, which appear to workout all muscle groups pretty well.

Was quite good other than logbook is difficult to use. Now it continually logs me out and forces me to log in repeatedly to access programs (or locks me out entirely) which makes a paid subscription a complete waste of money. The customer response was simply "be patient, we're trying" but this has been going on for weeks.

Best fitness and well-being app I've ever had. It's very easy to use, the coaches are fantastic and help keep you motivated, the range of programs available will suit every need and ability. I highly recommend if you are serious about your fitness and well-being

So, I had let myself go...gain weight and barely working out. I started walking again, but I knew I needed a coach! My daughter suggested Centr; I love this app. The Planner has given me SO MUCH MOTIVATION! I don't have to search for what workout to do each day; it's right there waiting for me each morning on the app. You don't have to use the planned workout, you can choose another workout like yoga! Great app and SO worth the cost paying yearly! I have even gotten on my bike again for warmup.

I've been using Centr for 3 years now. Right now, the App isn't usable on Android: attempting to sign in displays "Your session has expired" error and you can't actually do anything. Also troubling is the publisher's response to the many negative reviews here offering constructive feedback - a stock message saying "glad you are enjoying the app". Is anyone actually reading and responding to this issue? Very disappointing, if it's not fixed soon I'll be canceling my sub.

I have been looking at the reviews recently and thought i wasn't the only one having app issues, but looks like everybody else is having the same issues after the update. I have sent an email to tech team hoping to get an answer back or hoping that they will fix this logging in issue soon. Its so sad for paying something that doesn't work, please tech team fix it asap

I normally like this app and the workouts it provides. I have a year subscription but these past few weeks, the app is unusable. It logs you out within seconds of log-in. Don't buy until fixed, you're throwing money away and their help center will only offer some "free month" that you can't use anyways because of the dead app.

Had this app from Feb 19 on apple (ipad) and my actual phone (galaxy note). It has changed my life for the better. It really is worth the money, if you stick at it. The trainers are top class. If you are serious about training right and feeling great, then this app is it. It has everything in it, not just training routines. I highly recommend doing foundation training to strengthen your back. Buy it! Try it! Also, chromecast works to cast to TV. 10 stars!

Content is great, but the app just doesn't work reliably anymore. It's not little glitches either, nothing whatsoever loads. It would be frustrating in a free app, but in an expensive one it's in unforgivable.

The app and website are unusable for me for the last several days, any action performed results in being logged out. This is preventing me from following workouts and planning meals, which is the entire point of having this app. Prior to this, the app was good for what I needed it for. I do wish it allowed me to move around my default day for resting.

Overpriced compared to similar apps. Also, there are not alternate exercises (or easily accessible ones) for a lot of the activities. Lastly, today the app kept kicking me out of my workouts even though I have a subscription and it let me log in.
Love the work outs. Love the plans. Just wish the app for tablet didn't crash and work better. Phone app is great, except the volume of the instructors is kinda low when playing my own music.

Careful, if you sign up there is an auto renewal and there is no communication before they take the money. Like others I cancelled who have done reviews in the trial period but the auto renewal went through anyway. It turns back on and my bank is now looking into this. Support is no help and just quite terms and conditions. Their reply is 🤣🤣🤣

I really like the workouts and recipes, but the app is unusable at this point. Like other reviewers have mentioned, there is a bug that will sign you out of your account randomly while the app is open. It makes it impossible to do the workouts. When this is fixed it will be a five star review from me, but the current app version is broken.

This app has been great for giving me a daily schedule to follow and giving me a variety of different workouts to do. I am just working out again after many years of inactivity so the beginner workout has been great for slowly getting me used to working out again. The daily meal plans are also great and I am even using the nightly meditations that help me relax before bed. Overall, very happy with the app so far, and it is the first thing I do in the morning.

Terrible customer service and recurring fees. Requested to cancel in 2022 and never received a response. Forgot about it. Never used the app. Saw that I had been charged again in 2023 and realised it had auto renewed. No notice of renewal given. CS team just copy and paste T&Cs like robots and refuse refunds. No doubt I'll get a wet response like "sorry to hear that, but you can continue not using the app for another year whilst we keep your money"

I really love this app but I'm having an issue that, sometimes, it will log me out and, however many times I try to log back in, it will say that my session has timed out (my subscription is still valid). If you guys could fix this it would instantly up my rating to 5 stars ^^.

Ever since the last update I can barely get logged in before it is kicking me out for session expired. It's to the point that no matter what I do I cannot log in from my phone. Love the setup, hate the app log in problems.

This app used to be amazing when Chris Hemsworth was involved! now I would say this app is running into constant issues like "session expired" and this one is the worst can't even log in to this app without it kicking you off. I will definitely be looking for a better alternative when my subscription expires cuz this app is getting worst, and it's sad it was one of the best fitness app out there not anymore tho.

After selling out to big commerce, changing a well loved identity, commercialising the entity, firing the Aussie engineering team, the App no longer functions at all. Most users worldwide cannot even access their accounts to cancel subscriptions. People who have relied on the app for physical and mental health support for years have all of a sudden had the rug pulled from beneath them. Not OK. The way the issues have been handled throughout is unacceptable. From 5 stars to 1.

EDIT 8/24/2023: About a week ago, the app started logging me out and saying "session timed out" every time I would get onto the app. I emailed support and got a canned reply with no follow up.
